reviews.text: I have now stayed twice at this hotel on business both times. I have found the rooms to be clean and quite spacious. The beds are large and comfortable and the bathrooms are large and well stocked if a little dated in the old wing of the hotel. The food is fairly standard but the service in the restaurant is poor with breakfast waiting times for orders of up to twenty minutes. The idea of having the restaurant area in reception with just a veil spearating it from the entrance is not akin to hotels of this supposed standard and this makes the restaurant look cheap and nasty. The rooms do not have minibars which seems a bit strange for a hotel of this supposed standard, necessitating a long walk to the gym to get a drink from a vending machine at 3am!! The decor of the hotel is good in places an poor in others and generally could do a lot better.
reviews.title: Not all bad....Great gym!
Very poor
reviews.text: Things that are good are the setting which is great (although I am not a golfer I can see how this would be a good course for any keen enthusiast) and the gym which is easily fitness club standard on three levels with plenty of equipment and facilities. A good sized pool, jacuzzi, steam room and male/female saunas compliment what is, without a doubt, the stand out feature of this hotel.

The exterior of the hotel promises four star luxury but, in reality, the hotel only delivers three star service on the inside with staff bordering on the incoherent. The gym will keep me going back but I would shop around for best rates for this hotel as it is not worth the £150.00 per night quoted in reception. I pay £95.00 and I believe that is a lot for this standard hotel.
reviews.title: Not very impressed
Average to Poor
reviews.text: Our holiday was basically a golf weekend over two nights. There were 20 of us. The rooms as far as I know were fine. However that was about it.

reviews.title: Different Hotel
reviews.text: When we sat down to dinner on our first night we were handed a menu with 5 choices each for starter, main course and desert. We were told that there was only 4 tuna dishes and 5 duck dishes left, there were alternatives but the Chef wanted to use up his old stock first. (this is despite us dining at 7.45pm and the restuarant being half empty). The meals were also small. Then on to the bar which stopped taking cash at 11pm (very early for a hotel) and after that the drinks were charged to your room (which allowed extra VAT to be charged on top). The barman didn't know how to open a bottle of wine and we showed him how.

reviews.title: absolutely fantastic!
reviews.text: We were at the Manor of Groves for a wedding and decided to stay overnight with two young children and the setting could not have been any more perfect. The hotel staff were helpful and polite and took an obvious pride in their jobs. We had connecting rooms which meant some peace and quiet - bliss!

reviews.title: Great weekend break
reviews.text: We stayed at The Manor of Groves via a GolfBreaks deal and we couldn't have asked for a better experience. We arrived Thursday afternoon and checked in early as our room was already prepeared. This was in the 'newer' part of the hotel and was very large indeed. Very big double bed, separate seating area and a new very clean bathroom with shower. Straight out onto the course, unfortunately there was a very large society finishing, so the round was very slow - 4 hours for 12 holes when we gave up. Dinner in the evening was very good, with plenty to choose from on the menu. Breakfast the next day was again very good, plenty of hot and cold food to choose from and you could help yourself to as much as you wanted. We played golf in the morning on the Friday and it couldn't have been different from the previous day. There was virtually no-one on the course, which was in fantastic condition, so we had a great day - 4 hours for the complete round. Dinner in the evening was as good as the previous night, with plenty of choice, the service was effiecient and the staff friendly. Breakfast on the Saturday was similar to the previous day, although there were more people as they were preparing for a wedding. Our final round of golf was again very good, more players as it was the weekend, but still a fairly quick round - 4 1/2 hours. All in all, we had an excellent stay and could hardly fault the hotel or the golf course. We wouldn't hesitate in returning.

reviews.title: Great potential, but needs a lot of work
reviews.text: First problem was when we arrived and they had no record of our internet booking. We ordered drinks and sandwiches whilst waiting for room to be allocated. Despite very few people in dining/reception area, drinks took 15minutes to arrive and white wine was warm. Sandwiches took another 10 minutes and the order was wrong - they said that they had run out of white bread but had not bothered to check if brown was OK. They also ran out of cornflakes at breakfast!!!

reviews.title: The best wedding day ever
reviews.text: Room 12 was allocated and we made our way up to it through uncleaned corridors and stairs. The room was a good size, with views over the golf course, but the bathroom was extremely scruffy with a tatty hardboard side on the bath, crumbling plaster, the soap dispenser had come off wall and was stuck in the corner of the bath, etc, etc. The room was on the first floor and had a balcony running right around the wing, so people could walk straight past our full length window with nothing to stop them looking in. The balcony itself was in need of a good clean with cigarette ends and other litter lying about.

reviews.title: 3 star not 4 star......
reviews.text: As I was bringing a small case out of my car, I met a member of staff who insisted on helping me. When I commented on the state of the stairs, she agreed that it was a total mess and asked someone to sort it out. She was appalled at the bathroom and said that the tiles had come off and not been replaced and tried to get us another room. Unfortunately, whilst the bathroom of the second room was in a better state, it looked out over a rooftop and pipes, so we decided, on balance, to stick with the first room. Everywhere in this part of the building was scruffy - doors were left open showing the contents of cleaning and linen cupboards, paintwork was badly scuffed, hallways & stairways looked dirty, damp smell, etc. Room was adequate, but could have done with a really good clean.

reviews.title: Don't go for Valentine's Night!!!! (but nice for Weddings)
reviews.text: Apart from the room issue, we found the general attitude was depressing. I had booked a session in the salon, but was limited to very few treatments because they would only allocate 1 hour, despite the appointment book appearing to be virtually empty - so I cancelled. My request to join a scheduled Pilates class was declined on the grounds that no-one else had their names down for it. The reception bar was chilly and unwelcoming because the automatic door kept opening. The Brasserie restaurant was ok - if you really want to eat in a reception area with a view of everyone coming in or out of the hotel and hearing the reception phone ringing all the time. (At breakfast on Tuesday, I asked a waiter if he could get someone to answer it as it had rung continually for about 20 minutes and there was no-one in reception.) The other bar might have been nice if anyone had been serving there!!
